text.10_Mincha, 0_Ashrei, 104_Paragraph: God of Avraham, Yitzchak, and Yisrael,
text.10_Mincha, 0_Ashrei, 107_Paragraph: as the intention of the hearts of Your people,
text.10_Mincha, 0_Ashrei, 108_Paragraph: and direct their hearts to You.7Divrei Hayamim I 29:188May our recitation of the Kedushah inspire our thoughts and direct our hearts to serve You.—Avudraham
text.10_Mincha, 0_Ashrei, 110_Paragraph: atones iniquity and does not destroy;
text.10_Mincha, 0_Ashrei, 112_Paragraph: and does not arouse all His rage.9Tehillim 78:38
text.10_Mincha, 0_Ashrei, 113_Paragraph: For You, my Master, are good and forgiving,
text.10_Mincha, 0_Ashrei, 115_Paragraph: to all who call upon You.10Tehillim 86:5
text.10_Mincha, 0_Ashrei, 117_Paragraph: and Your Torah is truth.11Tehillim 119:142
text.10_Mincha, 0_Ashrei, 118_Paragraph: You will grant truth to Yaakov
text.10_Mincha, 0_Ashrei, 119_Paragraph: kindliness to Avraham,12The patriarchs symbolize the three pillars of the universe—Torah, avodah,—the Temple service and gemilas chasadim—kindliness. Yaakov epitomized Torah, which is the ultimate truth; Yitzchak personified Divine service in his readiness to be offered as a sacrifice to Hashem; and Avraham exemplified the ideal and practice of kindliness throughout his life. We thus pray to be granted a share in the Divine truth of Torah in Yaakov’s merit, and to receive Hashem’s kindliness in Avraham’s merit.
text.10_Mincha, 0_Ashrei, 120_Paragraph: as You have sworn to our fathers
text.10_Mincha, 0_Ashrei, 121_Paragraph: from the days of old.13Michah 7:20
text.10_Mincha, 0_Ashrei, 122_Paragraph: Blessed is my Master day by day;
text.10_Mincha, 0_Ashrei, 123_Paragraph: He loads us, [with blessings]14Etz Yosef interprets the verse in this manner: “Blessed is Adonoy who loads us each day with His blessings and goodness.”
text.10_Mincha, 0_Ashrei, 124_Paragraph: the Almighty Who is our deliverance,
text.10_Mincha, 0_Ashrei, 126_Paragraph: Adonoy of Hosts is with us
text.10_Mincha, 0_Ashrei, 128_Paragraph: is the God of Yaakov, selah.16Tehillim 46:8
text.10_Mincha, 0_Ashrei, 130_Paragraph: fortunate is the man who trusts in You.17Tehillim 84:13
text.10_Mincha, 0_Ashrei, 132_Paragraph: the King will answer us on the day we call.18Tehillim 20:10
text.10_Mincha, 0_Ashrei, 134_Paragraph: Who created us for His glory,19This phrase is based on Yeshaya 43:7 “Everything that is called by My Name, I have created it for My glory.”
text.10_Mincha, 0_Ashrei, 135_Paragraph: and set us apart from those who go astray;20This prayer is based on Yehoshua 24:2, 3, “Your fathers dwelt on the other side of the river—and they served other gods. And I took your father Avraham from the other side of the river.” See Bereishis 20:13 as interpreted by Onkelos.
text.10_Mincha, 0_Ashrei, 136_Paragraph: and gave us the Torah of truth,
text.10_Mincha, 0_Ashrei, 137_Paragraph: and eternal life He implanted within us.
text.10_Mincha, 0_Ashrei, 138_Paragraph: May He open our heart to His Torah,
text.10_Mincha, 0_Ashrei, 139_Paragraph: and instill in our heart love and awe of Him,
text.10_Mincha, 0_Ashrei, 140_Paragraph: to do His will and serve Him
text.10_Mincha, 0_Ashrei, 142_Paragraph: so that we shall not labor in vain21Some women are barren; they cannot bear children at all. Others have children who are unable to live. Similarly, there are those who study Torah only to criticize and ridicule what they learn, while others learn sincerely but later rebel against its teachings. Those who study to ridicule are comparable to the barren women who are unable to give birth. But those who later rebel are like those who bear children and bury them. We pray to Hashem to instill His love and fear in our hearts so that our learning will bear fruit and have a lasting influence on our lives.—Siddur HaGra
text.10_Mincha, 0_Ashrei, 143_Paragraph: nor bring forth that which causes dismay.21Some women are barren; they cannot bear children at all. Others have children who are unable to live. Similarly, there are those who study Torah only to criticize and ridicule what they learn, while others learn sincerely but later rebel against its teachings. Those who study to ridicule are comparable to the barren women who are unable to give birth. But those who later rebel are like those who bear children and bury them. We pray to Hashem to instill His love and fear in our hearts so that our learning will bear fruit and have a lasting influence on our lives.—Siddur HaGra
text.10_Mincha, 0_Ashrei, 145_Paragraph: Adonoy, our God, and God of our fathers,
text.10_Mincha, 0_Ashrei, 146_Paragraph: that we keep Your statutes in this world,
text.10_Mincha, 0_Ashrei, 147_Paragraph: and [thus] be privileged to live and behold,
text.10_Mincha, 0_Ashrei, 148_Paragraph: and to inherit the goodness and blessing
text.10_Mincha, 0_Ashrei, 150_Paragraph: and in the life of the World to Come.
text.10_Mincha, 0_Ashrei, 151_Paragraph: In order that my soul sing to You
text.10_Mincha, 0_Ashrei, 153_Paragraph: Adonoy, my God, forever will I thank You.22Tehillim 30:13
text.10_Mincha, 0_Ashrei, 154_Paragraph: Blessed is the man who trusts in Adonoy,23He does not just put his trust in Hashem while relying also upon a great many other factors which he considers the essential supports of his life and happiness. Hashem alone is the source of his trust; he relies on none other than Hashem.—S.R. Hirsch
text.10_Mincha, 0_Ashrei, 155_Paragraph: so that Adonoy is his security.24Yirmiyahu 17:7
text.10_Mincha, 0_Ashrei, 156_Paragraph: Trust in Adonoy until the end of days,
text.10_Mincha, 0_Ashrei, 158_Paragraph: Adonoy, is the strength of the worlds.25Yeshaya 26:4
text.10_Mincha, 0_Ashrei, 160_Paragraph: those who know26These are men of the highest caliber who perceive Hashem’s ways with undistorted clarity. They discern Hashem’s hand guiding the world in its constant, miraculous operation and they know with certainty that all is directed by Hashem.—Malbim your Name
text.10_Mincha, 0_Ashrei, 162_Paragraph: those who seek You, Adonoy.27Tehillim 9:11
text.10_Mincha, 0_Ashrei, 164_Paragraph: for the sake of His righteousness,
text.10_Mincha, 0_Ashrei, 165_Paragraph: to make the Torah great and to glorify it.28Yeshaya 42:21
text.10_Mincha, 0_Ashrei, 167_Paragraph: Exalted and sanctified be His great Name
text.10_Mincha, 0_Ashrei, 168_Paragraph: in the world which He created
text.10_Mincha, 0_Ashrei, 170_Paragraph: and may He rule His Kingdom
text.10_Mincha, 0_Ashrei, 171_Paragraph: in your lifetime and in your days,
text.10_Mincha, 0_Ashrei, 173_Paragraph: of the entire House of Yisrael,
text.10_Mincha, 0_Ashrei, 174_Paragraph: speedily and in the near future—
text.10_Mincha, 0_Ashrei, 176_Paragraph: May His great Name be blessed
text.10_Mincha, 0_Ashrei, 181_Paragraph: be the Name of the Holy One, blessed is He;
text.10_Mincha, 0_Ashrei, 185_Paragraph: which we utter in the world—and say Amein.
text.10_Mincha, 0_Ashrei, 187_Paragraph: When Rosh Hashana occurs on Shabbos, say:
text.10_Mincha, 0_Ashrei, 189_Paragraph: may my prayer to You, Adonoy,
text.10_Mincha, 0_Ashrei, 191_Paragraph: God, in the abundance of Your kindness,
text.10_Mincha, 0_Ashrei, 192_Paragraph: answer me with the truth of Your deliverance.
text.10_Mincha, 0_Ashrei, 193_Paragraph: When the Holy Ark is opened, the following is said:
text.10_Mincha, 0_Ashrei, 196_Paragraph: and let Your enemies be scattered,
text.10_Mincha, 0_Ashrei, 197_Paragraph: and those who hate You, flee before You.”
text.10_Mincha, 0_Ashrei, 198_Paragraph: For from Tziyon will go forth the Torah,
text.10_Mincha, 0_Ashrei, 199_Paragraph: and the word of Adonoy from Yerushalayim.
text.10_Mincha, 0_Ashrei, 200_Paragraph: Blessed is He Who gave the Torah
text.10_Mincha, 0_Ashrei, 201_Paragraph: to His people Yisrael in His holiness.
text.10_Mincha, 1_Berich Shemei, 0_Paragraph: The following prayer is taken from the Zohar (Parshas Vayakhail), the basic text of Kabbalah which was written by the Mishnahic sage Rabbi Shimon bar Yochai. The Zohar states, “When the Torah is taken out to be read before the congregation, the heavenly gates of mercy are opened, and the Divine love is aroused; therefore one should say the following prayer.
text.10_Mincha, 1_Berich Shemei, 2_Paragraph: of the Master of the Universe.
text.10_Mincha, 1_Berich Shemei, 3_Paragraph: Blessed is Your crown and Your place.
text.10_Mincha, 1_Berich Shemei, 6_Paragraph: The redemption of Your right hand,
text.10_Mincha, 1_Berich Shemei, 7_Paragraph: show Your people in Your Holy Temple.
text.10_Mincha, 1_Berich Shemei, 8_Paragraph: Bestow on us Your excellent light,
text.10_Mincha, 1_Berich Shemei, 9_Paragraph: and accept our prayer with compassion.
text.10_Mincha, 1_Berich Shemei, 11_Paragraph: to prolong our lives in well-being.
text.10_Mincha, 1_Berich Shemei, 14_Paragraph: so that You will have compassion on me
text.10_Mincha, 1_Berich Shemei, 15_Paragraph: and protect me and all that is mine,
text.10_Mincha, 1_Berich Shemei, 16_Paragraph: and all that belongs to Your people, Yisrael.
text.10_Mincha, 1_Berich Shemei, 18_Paragraph: Who nourishes all and maintains all;
text.10_Mincha, 1_Berich Shemei, 19_Paragraph: You are He Who rules over all;
text.10_Mincha, 1_Berich Shemei, 20_Paragraph: You are He Who rules over kings,
text.10_Mincha, 1_Berich Shemei, 23_Paragraph: of the Holy One, blessed is He,
text.10_Mincha, 1_Berich Shemei, 25_Paragraph: and before the honor of His Torah
text.10_Mincha, 1_Berich Shemei, 27_Paragraph: Not in man do I put my trust,
text.10_Mincha, 1_Berich Shemei, 28_Paragraph: nor do I rely on any angel;
text.10_Mincha, 1_Berich Shemei, 29_Paragraph: but only in the God of heaven
text.10_Mincha, 1_Berich Shemei, 35_Paragraph: In Him I put my trust
text.10_Mincha, 1_Berich Shemei, 36_Paragraph: and to His holy, honored Name
text.10_Mincha, 1_Berich Shemei, 39_Paragraph: to open my heart to Torah,
text.10_Mincha, 1_Berich Shemei, 40_Paragraph: and to fulfill the desires of my heart
text.10_Mincha, 1_Berich Shemei, 41_Paragraph: and of the heart of Your people Yisrael
text.10_Mincha, 1_Berich Shemei, 42_Paragraph: for goodness, for life, and for peace.
text.10_Mincha, 1_Berich Shemei, 44_Paragraph: Declare the greatness of Adonoy with me,
text.10_Mincha, 1_Berich Shemei, 45_Paragraph: and let us exalt His Name together.
text.10_Mincha, 1_Berich Shemei, 47_Paragraph: Yours, Adonoy, is the greatness, the might,
text.10_Mincha, 1_Berich Shemei, 48_Paragraph: the glory, the victory, and the beauty,
text.10_Mincha, 1_Berich Shemei, 49_Paragraph: for everything in heaven and on earth
text.10_Mincha, 1_Berich Shemei, 50_Paragraph: [is Yours]; Yours, Adonoy, is the kingdom,
text.10_Mincha, 1_Berich Shemei, 51_Paragraph: and You are uplifted over all rulers.
text.10_Mincha, 1_Berich Shemei, 53_Paragraph: and prostrate yourselves at His footstool,
text.10_Mincha, 1_Berich Shemei, 58_Paragraph: for Adonoy, our God, is holy.
text.10_Mincha, 1_Berich Shemei, 59_Paragraph: May the Father of mercy have compassion
text.10_Mincha, 1_Berich Shemei, 60_Paragraph: on the people borne by Him,
text.10_Mincha, 1_Berich Shemei, 65_Paragraph: and may He rebuke the Evil Impulse
text.10_Mincha, 1_Berich Shemei, 66_Paragraph: from those who have been carried by Him;
text.10_Mincha, 1_Berich Shemei, 67_Paragraph: and may He graciously grant us
text.10_Mincha, 1_Berich Shemei, 72_Paragraph: When the Torah is unrolled, the Reader says:
text.10_Mincha, 1_Berich Shemei, 73_Paragraph: May His sovereignty be revealed and visible
text.10_Mincha, 1_Berich Shemei, 75_Paragraph: and may He be gracious to our remnant
text.10_Mincha, 1_Berich Shemei, 76_Paragraph: and the remnant of His people,
text.10_Mincha, 1_Berich Shemei, 81_Paragraph: Let us all ascribe greatness to our God
text.10_Mincha, 1_Berich Shemei, 82_Paragraph: and give honor to the Torah.
text.10_Mincha, 1_Berich Shemei, 85_Paragraph: Blessed is He Who gave the Torah
text.10_Mincha, 1_Berich Shemei, 86_Paragraph: to His people, Yisrael, in His holiness.
text.10_Mincha, 1_Berich Shemei, 88_Paragraph: And you who cling to Adonoy, Your God,
text.10_Mincha, 1_Berich Shemei, 90_Paragraph: (The following blessings are recited by every person called to the Torah.)
text.10_Mincha, 1_Berich Shemei, 91_Paragraph: The Kohein walks up to the Torah, and says:
text.10_Mincha, 1_Berich Shemei, 93_Paragraph: The Congregation responds and the Kohein repeats:
text.10_Mincha, 1_Berich Shemei, 94_Paragraph: Blessed is Adonoy, Who is blessed,
text.10_Mincha, 1_Berich Shemei, 98_Paragraph: our God, King of the Universe,
text.10_Mincha, 1_Berich Shemei, 104_Paragrap: After the Torah is read, the Kohein says:
text.10_Mincha, 1_Berich Shemei, 106_Paragrap: our God, King of the Universe
text.10_Mincha, 1_Berich Shemei, 107_Paragrap: Who gave us the Torah of truth,
text.10_Mincha, 1_Berich Shemei, 108_Paragrap: and implanted eternal life within us.
text.10_Mincha, 1_Berich Shemei, 111_Paragrap: The above blessings are recited by every person called to the Torah.
text.10_Mincha, 1_Berich Shemei, 113_Paragrap: When the reading of the Torah is concluded, the Torah is raised so that the congregation can see the script, and the congregation exclaims:
text.10_Mincha, 1_Berich Shemei, 114_Paragrap: This is the Torah which Moshe placed
text.10_Mincha, 1_Berich Shemei, 116_Paragrap: at Adonoy’s command by the hand of Moshe.
text.10_Mincha, 1_Berich Shemei, 117_Paragrap: It is a tree of life
text.10_Mincha, 1_Berich Shemei, 118_Paragrap: to those who grasp to it,
text.10_Mincha, 1_Berich Shemei, 119_Paragrap: and those who support it are fortunate.
text.10_Mincha, 1_Berich Shemei, 120_Paragrap: Its ways are ways of pleasantness,
text.10_Mincha, 1_Berich Shemei, 121_Paragrap: and all its paths are peace.
text.10_Mincha, 1_Berich Shemei, 122_Paragrap: Long life is at its right,
text.10_Mincha, 1_Berich Shemei, 123_Paragrap: at its left, riches and honor.
text.10_Mincha, 1_Berich Shemei, 125_Paragrap: for the sake of His righteousness,
text.10_Mincha, 1_Berich Shemei, 126_Paragrap: to make the Torah great and to glorify it.
text.10_Mincha, 1_Berich Shemei, 127_Paragrap: The Chazzan takes the Torah and says:
text.10_Mincha, 1_Berich Shemei, 128_Paragrap: They will praise the Name of Adonoy
text.10_Mincha, 1_Berich Shemei, 129_Paragrap: for His Name alone is exalted.
text.10_Mincha, 1_Berich Shemei, 131_Paragrap: His majesty is over the earth and the skies.
text.10_Mincha, 1_Berich Shemei, 132_Paragrap: He will raise the might of His people,
text.10_Mincha, 1_Berich Shemei, 133_Paragrap: [which is] praise for all His pious ones,
text.10_Mincha, 1_Berich Shemei, 138_Paragrap: the earth is Adonoy’s and the fullness thereof,
text.10_Mincha, 1_Berich Shemei, 139_Paragrap: the inhabited world and those who dwell in it.
text.10_Mincha, 1_Berich Shemei, 140_Paragrap: For He founded it upon the seas,
text.10_Mincha, 1_Berich Shemei, 142_Paragrap: Who may ascend the mountain of Adonoy,
text.10_Mincha, 1_Berich Shemei, 144_Paragrap: in the place of His holiness?
text.10_Mincha, 1_Berich Shemei, 145_Paragrap: The clean of hands and the pure of heart,
text.10_Mincha, 1_Berich Shemei, 146_Paragrap: who has not borne My soul in vain,
text.10_Mincha, 1_Berich Shemei, 150_Paragrap: from the God of his deliverance.
text.10_Mincha, 1_Berich Shemei, 151_Paragrap: This is the generation of those who seek Him,
text.10_Mincha, 1_Berich Shemei, 157_Paragrap: so that the King of Glory may enter.
text.10_Mincha, 1_Berich Shemei, 158_Paragrap: Who is this King of Glory?
text.10_Mincha, 1_Berich Shemei, 160_Paragrap: Adonoy, the Mighty One in battle.
text.10_Mincha, 1_Berich Shemei, 162_Paragrap: and lift up, entranceways to eternity,
text.10_Mincha, 1_Berich Shemei, 163_Paragrap: so that the King of Glory may enter.
text.10_Mincha, 1_Berich Shemei, 164_Paragrap: Who is He, this King of Glory?
text.10_Mincha, 1_Berich Shemei, 166_Paragrap: He is the King of Glory, selah.
text.10_Mincha, 1_Berich Shemei, 167_Paragrap: As the Torah is returned to the Ark the following is said:
text.10_Mincha, 1_Berich Shemei, 168_Paragrap: And when it rested, he would say:
text.10_Mincha, 1_Berich Shemei, 170_Paragrap: to the myriads and thousands of Yisrael.
text.10_Mincha, 1_Berich Shemei, 171_Paragrap: Arise, Adonoy unto Your resting place,
text.10_Mincha, 1_Berich Shemei, 172_Paragrap: You and the Ark of Your strength.
text.10_Mincha, 1_Berich Shemei, 175_Paragrap: and let Your devoted ones sing in joy.
text.10_Mincha, 1_Berich Shemei, 176_Paragrap: For the sake of Dovid, Your servant,
text.10_Mincha, 1_Berich Shemei, 178_Paragrap: For I have given you good instruction,
text.10_Mincha, 1_Berich Shemei, 180_Paragrap: It is a tree of life to those who grasp it,
text.10_Mincha, 1_Berich Shemei, 181_Paragrap: and those who support it are fortunate.
text.10_Mincha, 1_Berich Shemei, 182_Paragrap: Its ways are ways of pleasantness
text.10_Mincha, 1_Berich Shemei, 183_Paragrap: and all its paths are peace.
text.10_Mincha, 1_Berich Shemei, 184_Paragrap: Cause us to return to You, Adonoy,
text.10_Mincha, 1_Berich Shemei, 186_Paragrap: renew our days as of old.
text.10_Mincha, 1_Berich Shemei, 188_Paragrap: Exalted and sanctified be His great Name
text.10_Mincha, 1_Berich Shemei, 189_Paragrap: in the world which He created
text.10_Mincha, 1_Berich Shemei, 191_Paragrap: and may He rule His Kingdom
text.10_Mincha, 1_Berich Shemei, 192_Paragrap: in your lifetime and in your days,
text.10_Mincha, 1_Berich Shemei, 194_Paragrap: of the entire House of Yisrael,
text.10_Mincha, 1_Berich Shemei, 195_Paragrap: speedily and in the near future—
text.10_Mincha, 1_Berich Shemei, 197_Paragrap: May His great Name be blessed
text.10_Mincha, 1_Berich Shemei, 202_Paragrap: be the Name of the Holy One, blessed is He;
text.10_Mincha, 1_Berich Shemei, 206_Paragrap: which we utter in the world—
text.10_Mincha, 2_Amidah, 3_Paragraph: and my mouth will declare Your praise.
text.10_Mincha, 2_Amidah, 5_Paragraph: our God, and God of our fathers,
text.10_Mincha, 2_Amidah, 6_Paragraph: God of Avraham, God of Yitzchak,
text.10_Mincha, 2_Amidah, 9_Paragraph: the Great, the Powerful, the Awesome,
text.10_Mincha, 2_Amidah, 13_Paragraph: Who remembers the piety of the Patriarchs,
text.10_Mincha, 2_Amidah, 16_Paragraph: for the sake of His Name, with love.
text.10_Mincha, 2_Amidah, 19_Paragraph: and inscribe us in the Book of Life,
text.10_Mincha, 2_Amidah, 21_Paragraph: If you forgot to say this, and became aware of your omission before saying the blessing, you should recite it. If you have already said “Blessed are You, Adonoy,” you must continue the prayers without saying “Remember.”
text.10_Mincha, 2_Amidah, 22_Paragraph: King, Helper, and Deliverer and Shield.
text.10_Mincha, 2_Amidah, 26_Paragraph: You are mighty forever, my Master;
text.10_Mincha, 2_Amidah, 27_Paragraph: You are the Resurrector of the dead
text.10_Mincha, 2_Amidah, 28_Paragraph: the Powerful One to deliver us.
text.10_Mincha, 2_Amidah, 29_Paragraph: Sustainer of the living with kindliness,
text.10_Mincha, 2_Amidah, 30_Paragraph: Resurrector of the dead with great mercy,
text.10_Mincha, 2_Amidah, 35_Paragraph: to those who sleep in the dust.
text.10_Mincha, 2_Amidah, 36_Paragraph: Who is like You, Master of mighty deeds,
text.10_Mincha, 2_Amidah, 37_Paragraph: and who can be compared to You?
text.10_Mincha, 2_Amidah, 38_Paragraph: King Who causes death and restores life,
text.10_Mincha, 2_Amidah, 39_Paragraph: and causes deliverance to sprout forth.
text.10_Mincha, 2_Amidah, 40_Paragraph: Who is like You merciful Father,
text.10_Mincha, 2_Amidah, 41_Paragraph: Who remembers His creatures for life,
text.10_Mincha, 2_Amidah, 43_Paragraph: If you forgot to say this, the same law applies as above concerning “Remember us for life.”
text.10_Mincha, 2_Amidah, 45_Paragraph: to restore the dead to life.
text.10_Mincha, 2_Amidah, 48_Paragraph: When the Chazzan repeats the Shemoneh Esreh, the Kedushah is said here
text.10_Mincha, 3_Kedushah, 0_Paragraph: The Congregation says and the Chazzan repeats:
text.10_Mincha, 3_Kedushah, 1_Paragraph: We will sanctify Your Name in the world,
text.10_Mincha, 3_Kedushah, 4_Paragraph: as is written by the hand of Your prophet,
text.10_Mincha, 3_Kedushah, 5_Paragraph: “And they called one to another, and said:
text.10_Mincha, 3_Kedushah, 9_Paragraph: the fullness of all the earth is His glory.’”
text.10_Mincha, 3_Kedushah, 16_Paragraph: And in Your holy words it is written:
text.10_Mincha, 3_Kedushah, 19_Paragraph: Your God, Tziyon, throughout all generations!
text.10_Mincha, 3_Kedushah, 27_Paragraph: will not depart from our mouth
text.10_Mincha, 3_Kedushah, 30_Paragraph: Who is King; Great, and Holy.
text.10_Mincha, 3_Kedushah, 31_Paragraph: During the silent Shemoneh Esreh, continue here:
text.10_Mincha, 3_Kedushah, 32_Paragraph: You are holy and Your Name is holy
text.10_Mincha, 3_Kedushah, 36_Paragraph: grant that Your awe, Adonoy, our God,
text.10_Mincha, 3_Kedushah, 38_Paragraph: and Your dread upon all You have created;
text.10_Mincha, 3_Kedushah, 39_Paragraph: and [then] all [Your] works will fear You,
text.10_Mincha, 3_Kedushah, 42_Paragraph: And may they all form a single band
text.10_Mincha, 3_Kedushah, 45_Paragraph: For we know Adonoy, our God
text.10_Mincha, 3_Kedushah, 48_Paragraph: might is in Your right hand
text.10_Mincha, 3_Kedushah, 52_Paragraph: grant honor, Adonoy, to Your people,
text.10_Mincha, 3_Kedushah, 53_Paragraph: praise to those who fear You,
text.10_Mincha, 3_Kedushah, 54_Paragraph: good hope to those who seek You
text.10_Mincha, 3_Kedushah, 56_Paragraph: to those who yearn for You,
text.10_Mincha, 3_Kedushah, 57_Paragraph: joy to Your land, gladness to Your city,
text.10_Mincha, 3_Kedushah, 58_Paragraph: flourishing of pride to Dovid, Your servant
text.10_Mincha, 3_Kedushah, 60_Paragraph: to the son of Yishai, Your anointed,
text.10_Mincha, 3_Kedushah, 63_Paragraph: the righteous will see [this] and rejoice,
text.10_Mincha, 3_Kedushah, 64_Paragraph: and the upright will be jubilant,
text.10_Mincha, 3_Kedushah, 65_Paragraph: and the pious will exult with joyous song;
text.10_Mincha, 3_Kedushah, 67_Paragraph: and all the wickedness will vanish like smoke,
text.10_Mincha, 3_Kedushah, 68_Paragraph: when You remove the rule of evil
text.10_Mincha, 3_Kedushah, 74_Paragraph: and in Yerushalayim, city of Your Sanctuary,
text.10_Mincha, 3_Kedushah, 75_Paragraph: as it is written in Your holy words,
text.10_Mincha, 3_Kedushah, 80_Paragraph: Holy are You, and awesome is Your Name,
text.10_Mincha, 3_Kedushah, 81_Paragraph: and there is no God beside You,
text.10_Mincha, 3_Kedushah, 85_Paragraph: and the Almighty, the Holy One,
text.10_Mincha, 3_Kedushah, 89_Paragraph: You chose us from [among] all the peoples;
text.10_Mincha, 3_Kedushah, 90_Paragraph: You loved us and took pleasure in us;
text.10_Mincha, 3_Kedushah, 91_Paragraph: You exalted us above all tongues,

text.11_Tashlich, 0_Paragraph: On the first day of Rosh Hashana [or on the second day if the first day is Shabbos], after the Mincha Services, before sunset, it is customary to go to a body of water [the ocean, river, lake, etc.] but preferably one which contains fish, and recite the following prayers. The opening verses are taken from Micah 7:18-20 and they correspond to the thirteen Divine Attributes mentioned in Shemos 34:6,7. The closing verses are from Psalms 118:5-9 which correspond to the nine attributes mentioned in Bamidbar 14:18.
text.11_Tashlich, 1_Paragraph: According to Maharam Yaffe the custom of the Tashlich ritual is based on the Midrash. “As Avraham was about to sacrifice Yitzchak, the Satan disguised himself as a raging river. Upon approaching the river, Avraham went in wading up to his waist. Thinking he would be able to ford the river, he summoned Yitzchak and they had taken but a few steps when the water surged up to their necks. Avraham cried out, “Deliver us Adonoy, for the water is drowning us,” and they were saved. Others say that water is the symbol of kindness, and fish symbolize an ever-open eye. Thus we ask God to bestow His benevolent kindness on us and protect us with His watchful eye.
